title: Space Force selects startup Defense Unicorns to update software at launch ranges
summary: The startup won a $15 million Strategic Funding Increase, or STRATFI, agreement from SpaceWERX.

title: FAA Approves Third Starship Test Flight for Thursday
summary: The FAA issued a launch license today for SpaceX to conduct the third Orbital Flight Test (OFT-3) of their Starship rocket tomorrow, March 14. The date was announced last week […]

title: After Months of Preparations Starship is Ready for Flight 3
summary: Starship Flight 3 is set and ready to fly after months of preparations and SpaceX learning from the issues encountered during Flight 2. Booster 10 and Ship 28 are the most advanced pair of vehicles yet to be slated for an integrated test flight of Starship.

title: Space One’s Kairos Explodes on Maiden Flight
summary: It has been a tough start for the fledgling private aerospace industry in Japan. On March 13th 2024, private aerospace company SPACE ONE aimed to perform the first private satellite launch from Japan. Launching from the company’s Space Port Kii, the Kii-based Advanced & Instant ROcket System (KAIROS) rocket carried a payload for the Japanese government, a satellite that would’ve acted as a temporary contingency incase of malfunctions aboard active intelligence satellites. This satellite however would not be deployed, or even delivered to space, as about five seconds after the rocket launched, the rocket detonated.

title: Omnispace to test direct-to-smartphone LEO plans with Africa’s biggest telco
summary: Omnispace is exploring how its proposed constellation of more than 600 low Earth orbit satellites could help connect phones and other devices subscribed to MTN, Africa’s largest terrestrial mobile network operator.

title: SpaceX cleared to attempt third Starship launch Thursday after getting FAA license
summary: Elon Musk’s SpaceX is preparing to launch its third Starship test flight as soon as Thursday morning after federal regulators signed off on the attempt.

title: Space Development Agency marks five-year milestone
summary: Once on the chopping block, SDA now has a $4.2 billion budget to build a satellite network of hundreds of satellites

title: Global communications are under attack — optical satellite networks can bolster them
summary: Recent alleged Houthi attacks on underwater communication cables illustrate the need for more resilient connectivity technology, such as optical ground station networks.

title: Mining helium-3 on the Moon has been talked about forever—now a company will try
